221
SUBSEQUENTLY FOUND PROPERTY
(1) If after the finality of a decree of distribution property is found which, at the time of the issuance of the aforementioned decree, it was not known that it belonged to the estate, the court shall not carry out another probate hearing; instead it shall distribute the property by a new decree based on the previous decree of distribution.
(2) If there was previously no probate hearing, the court shall carry one out only when the found property consists of immovable property.
(3) When the found property consists of movable property, the court shall carry out a probate hearing only at the request of those affected.
